quote: The Borg are attempting to lock on    to us...
Evasive maneuvers... delta pattern...
Delta pattern initiated...
They've locked on...
Our shields are being drained...     sixty-four percent... forty-two...
Recalibrate shield nutation...
Modulation is having no effect...
Shields have failed.
Full reverse... maintain...
Damage report...
Damage report...
Direct hit... decks one through    four...

Let's get the civilians to the escape    pods, Lieutenant...
Leave everything... Go to your    assigned evacuation area now.
Warning.  Damage to warp core.   Containment failure in three    minutes...
Doran...
I'll take care of her... go on...
Have you seen Jennifer...
It's gonna be okay... I'll get you    out of there... you're gonna be    okay...
Okay, Jake... we'll just get your    Mom now and get outta here...
Commander...
Help me...
Sir, we have to get to the...
Just help me get her free...
She's gone.  There's nothing we can    do...
Warning.  Damage to warp core.   Containment failure in two    minutes...
You go ahead, Lieutenant.  Take the    boy.
Now, sir...
Dammit... we can't leave her here...
Jake?
There you are...
How they biting?
Small fries.  Threw 'em back.   You want to go for a swim?
Don't have time.  We've got to get    ready.
It won't be so bad.  I've heard Bajor    is a beautiful world...
So why can't we live on the planet    instead of some old space station?
Well, it's what Starfleet decided...
You promised we'd stay on shore duty.
The station is in orbit of Bajor,    Jake.  It'll be just like shore duty.
Will there be kids there?
Absolutely.  Lots of kids.
Bridge to Sisko.
Yes, Captain...
We're approaching Deep Space Nine,    Commander.  We'll be docking in seven    minutes.
Acknowledged.    (puts his arm around     Jake)   C'mon, we'll take the pond with us.
Computer, end program.
Is that it?

Commence station log, Deep Space    Nine, Commander Benjamin Sisko,    Stardate xxxxx.x.  At the request of    the Bajoran provisional government,    Starfleet has agreed to establish a    Federation presence in this system    following the withdrawal of Cardassian    occupational forces.
Sorry about that, Commander...  all    the interlock servos in this airlock    were stripped by the Cardassians...
scene: 23   INT. AIRLOCK - CLOSE ON MILES O'BRIEN

quote: Miles O'Brien, your chief operations    officer...
scene: 23   INT. AIRLOCK - CLOSE ON MILES O'BRIEN

quote: I'm told the Cardassians decided to    have some fun the day they left...    four Bajorans were killed trying to    protect their shops...
Why hasn't anybody cleaned this up...
We've got all available personnel    assigned to repairing primary systems,    sir... the Cardassians took every    component of value, we have virtually    no defenses...
Understood.  But what about the    civilians who operated these shops... ?
A lot of them lost everything...
Welcome, Commander.  Please enter.
Another time, perhaps.
Another time.
When my wife, Keiko, saw our quarters,    she started talking about visiting    her mother in Kumomoto...
Sir, I wouldn't allow the boy to go    roaming... we're still having some    security problems...
Dad... !
There's nothing to sleep on in here    except a cushion on the floor!
We can get you a real bunk off the    Enterprise...       Oh, and I almost forgot, Captain    Picard wants to see you as soon as    possible.
(eyes off O'Brien, a     throwaway)   He does...
Any word on our science and medical    officers?
They're expected tomorrow.
Jake, I want you to stay here until    I come back...
Is this the food replicator?
I'm afraid they're all off-line...     there's plenty of emergency rations...    I could send some down...
Dad...
We're just gonna have to rough it    til we get things up and running,    Jake... okay?
Okay.
(this isn't going to     work, but I'll try     to make it look that     I really think it     will, smiles)   Okay.
I'd like to ask the designer what he    was thinking about when they built    this place... I still haven't been    able to find an O-D-N access... that's    the Prefect's office up there...
So all others have to look up with    respect.  Cardassian architecture.
Yessir.       Major Kira has been using it...
Is it my imagination or is it    unusually warm... ?
The environmental controls in Ops    are stuck at thirty-two "C"...  we're    working on it.
I guess it's time to meet Major    Kira...
Sir, have you ever served with any    Bajoran women?
No.  Why?
Just wondering, sir.
... You're being a fool...
... THEN DON'T ASK FOR MY OPINION    NEXT TIME!
Yes?
I'm Benjamin Sisko...
I suppose you want the office.
Well, actually I thought I'd say    hello first and then take the    office... but we could do it in any    order you'd like.
Hello.
Is something bothering you, Major?
You don't want to ask me that,    Commander...
Why not?
Because I have a bad habit of telling    the truth... even when people don't    want to hear it.
Perhaps I want to hear it.
I don't believe the Federation has    any business being here.
The provisional government disagrees    with you...
The provisional government and I    don't agree on a lot of things...    which is probably why they've sent    me to this god-forsaken place.

I have been fighting for Bajoran    independence since I was old    enough to pick up a phaser...     finally, we drive out the    Cardassians... and what do our new    leaders do... call up the Federation    and invite them in...
The Federation is only here to...
... help us/you.
... yes, I know.  The Cardassians    said the same thing sixty years ago.
Major, when I was ordered here, I    requested a Bajoran national as my    first officer.  It made sense.  It    still does.  At least to me.  Now,    you and I are gonna have to...
Odo, are you reading something at A-   fourteen?
My security array has been down for    two hours... I'll meet you there...
We've been having a lot of break-ins    lately... no need to come along,    Commander...
Hurry up.
All right, just stand where you are.
That's enough.
Who the hell are you?
This is our new Starfleet Commander,    Odo.
I don't allow weapons on the    Promenade.  That includes phasers.
Nog?  What's going on?
The boy's in a lot of trouble.

Commander, my name is Quark.  I used    to run the local gambling    establishment... this is my brother's    boy... surely you can see that he    only has a peripheral involvement in    all this... we're scheduled to depart    tomorrow...  if we could be permitted    to take him, I promise you he will    be severely...
That won't be possible.       Take him to the brig.
Quark probably sent the two of them    here to steal the ore samples in the    first place...
Major, there's a Ferengi legal    tradition... it's called Plea    Bargaining.  I might let the boy    go... but I want something in exchange    from Mister Quark...  something very    important...
O'Brien to Commander Sisko.
Go ahead.
Sir, the Enterprise hailed us again.     Captain Picard is waiting to see    you.
Acknowledged.       This won't take long.
Come.
Commander, come in.  Welcome to Bajor.
It's been a long time, Captain.
Have we met before?
Yessir.  We met in battle.  I was on    the Saratoga at Wolf 359.
I assume you've been briefed on the    events leading to the Cardassian    withdrawal.
Yessir... I understand they've spent    the last half century robbing the    planet of every valuable resource...     before abandoning it...
They've left the Bajorans without    any way to be self-sustaining...     the relief efforts we've been    coordinating are barely adequate.
I've come to know the Bajora.   I'm one of the strongest    proponents for their entry into    the Federation.
Is it going to happen?
Not easily.  The ruling parties    are at each others throats...   factions that were united against    the Cardassians have resumed old    conflicts...
Sounds like they're not ready.
Your job is to do everything short    of violating the Prime Directive to    make sure they are.
Starfleet has made me aware of your    objections to this assignment,    Commander.  I would think that after    three years at the Utopia Planitia    yards, you'd be ready for a change.
I have a son that I'm raising alone,    Captain.  This is not the ideal    environment.
Unfortunately, as Starfleet officers,    we do not always have the luxury of    serving in an ideal environment.
I realize that, sir.  And I'm    investigating the possibility of    returning to Earth for civilian    service.
Perhaps Starfleet Command should    begin to consider a replacement for    you.
That's probably a good idea.
I'll look into it.  In the meantime...
In the meantime, I'll do the job    I've been ordered to do to the best    of my ability, sir... thank you for    the briefing.
Dismissed.
It's really quite simple, Quark,    you're not going to leave.

quote: Commander, I've made a career out of    knowing when to leave.  This Bajoran    provisional government is far too    provisional for my taste.  And when    governments fall, people like me are    lined up and shot...
scene: 44   INT. SECURITY OFFICE - STARTING ON QUARK

quote: (preparing to leave,     overly "sincere")   That poor kid is about to spend the    best years of his life in a Bajoran    prison.  I'm a father myself.  I    know what your brother must be going    through.  The boy should be with his    family... not in a cold jail cell...       Think about it.
scene: 44   INT. SECURITY OFFICE - STARTING ON QUARK

quote: You know, at first I didn't think I    was gonna like him.

quote: Major... ?
Everyone else is busy repairing the    primary systems...
I suppose Starfleet officers aren't    used to getting their hands dirty...
In the refugee camps, we learned to    do whatever had to be done...  it    didn't matter who you were...
I was just talking to our good    neighbor Quark... he's laying odds    the government's going to fall...
Quark knows a sure bet when he sees    it.       This government will be gone in a    week... and so will you...
What happens to Bajor then?
Civil War....
You think it's inevitable...
...   The only one who can prevent it...    is Opaka.
Opaka?
Our spiritual leader.  She's known    as the Kai.  Our religion is the    only thing that holds my people    together.  If she would call for    unity, they would listen.
Leaders of all the factions have    been trying to get to her... but she    lives in seclusion and rarely sees    anyone...
Commander.  It is time.
Commander Sisko...
I apologize for the conditions in    which we greet you...
The Cardassians... ?
Your arrival has been greatly    anticipated.
I'm glad to hear that.  If Bajor can    join the Federation it will bring    stability...
I do not speak of the Federation.   I speak of your arrival...
Mine?
Have you ever explored your pagh,    Commander?
Pagh?
A Bajoran draws courage from his    spiritual life... our lifeforce, our    pagh, is replenished by the    prophets...
(knowingly, with     sympathy)   Breathe.
Kai Opaka, if we could discuss your    role in the post-Cardassian    transition...
Breathe.
Ironic.  One who does not wish to be    among us is to be the emissary.
Please come with me...
You are correct that Bajor is in    grave jeopardy... but it is the threat    to our spiritual life that far    outweighs any other...

quote: What... the hell... Opaka?
Ahh...
Hey!
I'm sorry... it's just that the sand    was burning my...
Jen... Jennifer... ?
Yes... ?  I'm sorry... did we meet    last night at George's party... ?
George?  Jennifer... wait a minute,    this is impossible.
Are you okay?
(looking around,     stunned, to himself)   I know this place... This is Gilgo    Beach.  Where we met.
We've met here... before?
I was carrying...
... three lemonades...
My feet were burning... I stopped    here... do you understand how    incredible this is?  No of course    you don't.  Jennifer.
Have a lemonade.
Sorry, I don't accept drinks from    strange men on the beach...
Tell me the truth.  Did we really    meet before?
No.
(smiles, shakes her     head)   So how did you know my name?
I...       George told me... at the party...
Are you going to tell me your name?
Oh.  Sorry.  Ben Sisko.  I...   I just graduated from Starfleet    Academy... I'm waiting for my    first posting...
A junior officer.  My mother warned    me to watch out for junior officers...
Your mother's going to adore me.
You're awfully sure of yourself.
It's not every day you meet the girl    you're going to marry.
Do you use this routine a lot with    women... ?
No.  Never before.  And never again.
Sure...
How about letting me cook dinner for    you tonight... my father was a gourmet    chef... I'll make his famous aubergine    stew.
I don't know...
You're supposed to say yes...
I'll probably be sorry...
Jennifer...
Is it some kind of holographic device?

No.  What you experienced barely    begins to reveal its powers...   This orb appeared in the skies    over ten thousand years ago.   Eight others have been discovered    since. Tradition says they    were sent from the Celestial Temple.   What they have taught us has    shaped our theology.
It will lead you to the Temple.
Excuse me... ?
You must find the Celestial Temple    and warn the prophets.
Warn "them" about what?

The Cardassians took the other    eight orbs.  They will stop at    nothing to decipher their    powers... even if it means    discovering where they came from.   If they do, they might destroy    the Celestial Temple itself...    which could mean the spiritual    disintegration of Bajor.
To expect me to go off on some sort    of... of quest...
I cannot unite my people until I    know that the prophets have been    forewarned.

You will seek the prophets.  In the    end, not for Bajor and not for the    Federation... but for yourself, for    your own pagh.  It is, quite simply,    Commander, the journey you have always    been destined to take.
What?
I was just thinking how much you    look like your mom.
Kira to Sisko...
Go ahead, Major.
Sorry to disturb you, Commander.   But there's something on the    Promenade you might want to see.

Fortune's fates are with you today,    friends... prompt wagers, please...    I'm sorry, Madame, Quark's does not    accept travelers' vouchers... gold    or hard currency, please... final    wagers...

quote: Station log.  Stardate xxxxx.x.   The Enterprise has been ordered    to the Lapolis system. They're    scheduled to depart at zero-five    hundred hours after offloading    three runabout class vessels.   Meanwhile, our medical and science    officers are arriving... and I'm    looking forward to a reunion with    a... very old... friend.
Commander, if you'd like me to give    them a tour of the station...
You and Doctor Bashir go ahead...
Maybe we could get together later,    Jadzia... for dinner or a drink...
I'd be delighted.
He's a little young for you, isn't    he?
He's twenty-seven.  i'm twenty-   eight.
Three hundred and twenty-eight, maybe.     Did you tell him about that slug    inside you?
Yes, Benjamin, he knows I'm a    Trill.  He finds it fascinating.   He's never met a joined species    before.
I wonder if he'd've been as fascinated    if you still looked the way you did    the last time I saw you.
Perhaps not.
This is going to take some getting    used to.
Don't be ridiculous.  I'm still the    same Dax...       ... more or less...
I'm afraid we've had some security    problems... looks like looters got    in here...
This'll be perfect... real...    (searching for the     right description)   ... frontier medicine...
Frontier medicine?
Major... I had my choice of any job    in the fleet...
Did you...
I didn't want some cushy job...  or    a research grant... I wanted this.     The farthest reaches of the galaxy.    One of the most remote outposts    available.
This is where the adventure is.   This is where heroes are made.   Right here.  In the wilderness.
This wilderness is my home.
I didn't mean...

The Cardassians left behind a lot of    injured people, Doctor... you can    make yourself useful by bringing    some of your Federation Medicine to    the "natives"...  you'll find    them a friendly, simple folk...
We do have one advantage.  The monks    have been studying these things for    ten thousand years...

quote: That should give us something...
scene: 74   INT. LABORATORY - CLOSE ON THE ORB (OPTICAL)

quote: Benjamin...       I was happy when I heard you'd    accepted this assignment... I'd been    worried about you...

quote: (recognizes him,     surprised)   Curzon... ?
The Captain's in the ready room,    Chief... Should I tell him you're    here?
(a beat, shakes his     head)   That's okay.  Thanks.
Transport me to the Ops pad, Maggie...
Yessir.
Mister O'Brien...
I believe I just missed you on the    bridge...
Yessir... I didn't want to disturb    you...
Your favorite transporter room, isn't    it... ?
Number three, yessir.
You know, yesterday, I called down    here... and asked for you without    thinking.  It won't be quite the    same...
It's just a transporter room, sir.
Permission to disembark, Captain... ?
Permission granted.
Energize.
Just a follow-up, Ben... that old    house you asked about on Moravian    Lane is available... it's yours if    you want it... we look forward to    hearing your decision.
Kira to Commander Sisko.  A Cardassian    warship has just entered Bajoran    space...
On screen.
Message coming in from their    commander, Gul Dukat...
Dukat.  He used to be the Cardassian    Prefect of Bajor...
He's requesting permission to come    aboard... to greet us...       Surely a coincidence that the    Enterprise just left...
Mister O'Brien, tell Gul Dukat I    look forward to meeting him.
Good day, Commander.
(nods a greeting,     rising)   Gul Dukat...
Excuse my presumption, but this was    my office only two weeks ago...
So, have you been able to get the    food replicators to work properly?
Frankly, no.
Neither could we.  That's one    technology you have over us.  You do    know how to make a perfect onion    soup.
I'm not used to being on this side    of the desk.
I'll be honest with you, Commander.     I miss this office.   I wasn't happy about leaving it.
Drop by any time you're feeling    homesick...

You are very gracious.  And allow me    to assure you that we only want to    be helpful in this difficult    transition.  You are far from the    Federation fleet, alone in this remote    outpost, with poor defense systems.     Your Cardassian neighbors will be    quick to respond to any problems you    might have.
We'll try to keep the dog off your    lawn.
So what did you think of Kai Opaka?
Oh, I stay informed... I know you    went to the surface to see her...
I don't know anything about an orb.

We will be in close proximity should    you wish to reconsider my suggestion.     In the meantime, I assume you have    no objection to my men enjoying the    hospitality of the Promenade.       Commander...
What do you know about the Denorios    Belt?
Your basic charged plasma field...     nobody gets anywhere near it unless    they have to...
(summarizing what     she's reading)   In the twenty-second century, a ship    carrying Kai Taluno was disabled for    several days in the Denorios Belt...     where he claims he had a vision...
Let me guess -- he saw the Celestial    Temple of the Prophets.
Not quite, but he did say "the heavens    opened up and nearly swallowed his    ship... "
Are we reduced to chasing metaphors    to solve this?
That's not all.  At least five of    the orbs were found in the Denorios    Belt...
... There have also been twenty-three    navigational reports over the years    of severe neutrino disturbances in    the same area...
And thirty-two years ago, a vessel    of unknown origin appeared there,    carrying a single lifeform, a species    never encountered before.
Our Celestial Temple?
Worth a look...
We've got a Cardassian on our back    doorstep... we need to get by them    undetected...
Can we have your attention, please...    this establishment is being closed...
What do you mean?  You can't do this.
If you have a problem, sir, you'll    have to take it up with Commander    Sisko...
I intend to.  This is outrageous...    my apologies friends... a minor    misunderstanding that will be    rectified shortly...
Give them something to put their    winnings in...
... because we were winning too much,    of course...

quote: Leave it to Starfleet to ruin a fine    day...

quote: Rio Grande to Ops.  Initializing pre-   launch systems...
Confirmed.
Major, scanners are picking up    fluctuations in the Cardassian's    energy distribution net...
Their computer's crashing...  shields    and sensors are down...   Odo's done it... Ops to Rio Grande...
Go ahead.
We're in business.
Beginning launch sequence.
Maintain visual blackout.  Set audio    to secure channel three-five-zero.
Odo's reached the transport site...
Trying to lock on...
I've never done this with a Cardassian    Transporter...
Dammit, what's the problem...
Nice work, Constable.
Approaching grid perimeter...
Slowing to one quarter impulse.
Computer, give me visual at bearing    two-three, mark two-one-seven, range    thirty-one hundred kilometers...
Sensors are picking up unusually    high proton counts...
Setting a new course to those    coordinates...
All external wave intensities are    increasing rapidly but... checking...    confirmed... there is no corresponding    increase inside the cabin... how is    that poss...
Sensors are not functioning...
We've lost all contact with the space    station...
Scanners are reading a major subspace    disruption at their last known    coordinates...
What the hell is happening out there?
I don't know, sir.  They're just...       ...gone.
Are your navigational readings going    crazy?
I'll recalibrate them when I have a    moment.
(hanging on for dear     life)   Take your time.
Can you get a fix on our    coordinates... ?
There's a star just under five light    years away... no M class planets...    Computer, identify closest star    system...
Idran... a ternary system consisting    of a central supergiant and twin O-   type companions...
Idran... that can't be right...
Computer, basis of identification...
Identification of Idran is based on    the hydrogen-alpha spectral analysis    conducted in the twenty-second century    by the Quadros-One probe of the Gamma    Quadrant.
The Gamma Quadrant.  Seventy    thousand light years from Bajor?   I'd say we just found our way into    a wormhole...
It's not like any wormhole I've ever    seen.  There were none of the usual    resonance waves...
Could this be how the orbs found    their way into the Bajoran system?
Not an unreasonable hypothesis.
If it's true, that would mean this    has been here for ten thousand years.     We might have just discovered the    first stable wormhole known to exist.
You may want to wait until we get    safely back before you put your name    in the history books, Benjamin...
Our names, old man, our names...     bring us about, Lieutenant...
I'm modifying the flight program to    compensate for the spatial    discontinuities.  We should have a    smoother ride this time.
Did you reduce impulse power?
No...
We're losing velocity...
Power output is still constant...
Increasing impulse reactor output...
Forward velocity down to one twenty    kph...
Engine output is running seventy    percent above normal...
Down to eighty kph...
Warning, impulse system overload...    auto shutdown in twelve seconds...
Disengaging engines.
Velocity is twenty kph.       I'm picking up an atmosphere,    Benjamin...
Inside a wormhole?
Capable of supporting life...
We've just landed...
On what?
It's beautiful.
You have a strange eye for beauty...
You don't think this is one of the    most idyllic settings you've ever    seen... ?
It can't beat the sulfuric mine pits    of Hadas Four...
How can you say that?  The colors...    all the flora...
I don't see any flora, Dax...
We're standing in a garden...
We're standing on a rockface...       Do you see the storms?
Clear as a summer's day.
You see it too...
Low level ionic pattern, it's probing    us...
Someone's idea of shaking hands,    maybe...
I am Commander Benjamin Sisko of the    United Federation of Planets...
Another neutrino disruption...
Scanners are picking up an object    near their last known coordinates...    it isn't a ship...
Major, there's something inside it...    some kind of lifeform...
Are the Cardassian sensors picking    it up?
They should be back on line by now...    We have to assume they know everything    we know...
Yellow alert... secure Ops. Beam it    aboard Mister O'Brien, but put it in    a level one security field...
Aye, sir... locking on...
Who are you?
Who are you?
It is corporeal... a physical    entity...
What... what did you say...
It is responding to visual and    auditory stimuli... linguistic    communication...
Yes, linguistic communication...     are you capable of communicating    with me?
What are you?
My species is known as human.
Earth?
This... this is what my planet looks    like...
You and I are very different species.     It will take time for us to understand    one another.
Time.  What is this?  Time...
It's not an ordinary wormhole.   My analysis suggests it isn't even    a natural phenomenon...
Not natural... you mean it was
It's very possible that whoever made    the orbs also created this wormhole.
The Cardassians are leaving their    position... on a course toward the    Denorios Belt.
What would it take to move this    station to the mouth of the wormhole?
This isn't a starship, Major.
It's got to be there tomorrow.
That's not possible, sir...
That wormhole might just reshape the    future of this entire quadrant.  The    Bajorans have to stake a claim to    it...
(beat, character     movement)   And I have to admit that claim will    be a lot stronger if there's a    Federation presence to back it up.
Couldn't you modify the subspace    field output of the deflector    generators... just enough to create    a low-level field around the    station...
So we could lower the inertial mass...
If you can make the station lighter,    those six thrusters would be all the    power we'd need.
(a beat, it might     just work)   This whole station could break apart    like an egg if it doesn't work...
Even if it does work, we're going to    need help from Starfleet once we get    there...
The Enterprise is still the nearest    starship... it would take them two    days to get here...
Advise Starfleet that we will require    their assistance.
You have Ops, Mister O'Brien...       Lieutenant, you're with me... you    too, Doc, time to be a hero...
Yes, Sir...
Constable...
(anticipating, right     on top of her voice)   This is a security matter... I'm in    charge of security...
... security here, on the station.

I can't justify taking you into this    wormhole... we don't know what we're    dealing with in there... it could be    hostile...        DEEP SPACE: "Emissary" REV. FINAL 08/25/92 - ACT FIVE      83A.
Major, I was found in the Denorios    Belt.  I don't know where I came    from... no idea if there are any others    like me.

All my life, I've been forced to    pass myself off as one of you...     always wondering who I really am.   The answers to a lot of my    questions may be somewhere on the    other side of that wormhole.
You coming?
as we saw him in Act Two... but it    is an alien Picard...
scene: 177  INT. ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - SUBJECTIVE POV -

quote: The creature must be destroyed before    it destroys us.
scene: 177  INT. ENTERPRISE OBSERVATION LOUNGE - SUBJECTIVE POV -

quote: It is malevolent.

quote: in a batter's box, dressed in a    Chicago Cubs uniform of the early    1920s...

quote: Aggressive.  Adversarial.

quote: It must be destroyed.
I'm not your enemy... I've been sent    here by the people you contacted.
Contacted?
With your devices.  Your orbs...
We seek contact with other    lifeforms... not corporeal creatures    who would annihilate us...
I have not come to annihilate    anyone...
Destroy it now...
My species respects life above all    else.  Can you say the same?
I do not understand the threat I    bring to you.  But I am not your    enemy.  Allow me to prove it.
Prove it?
scene: 184A INT. CHAMBER BENEATH THE MONASTERY - OPAKA ALIEN

quote: It can be argued that a human is    ultimately the sum of his experiences.     You obviously have access to mine.
scene: 184A INT. CHAMBER BENEATH THE MONASTERY - OPAKA ALIEN

quote: "Experiences" - what is this?
Memories... events from my past...     like this one...
Past?
Things that happened before now...
You have absolutely no idea what I'm    talking about.
What comes before now is no different    than what is now...  or what is to    come.  It is one's existence.
(beginning to     understand)   Then, for you, there is no linear    time...
"Linear time" - what is this?
My species lives in one point in    time.  And once we move beyond that    point, it becomes the past.
Does not exist yet?
That is the nature of a linear    existence.  And if you examine it    more closely, you will see that you    do not need to fear me.
Dammit!  Computer... analyze subspace    field integrity...
Power frequency imbalance is    preventing field closure...
Add reactor three to the power grid...
Partial field established.
Partial field.       Is the station's inertial mass low    enough to break orbit?
Procedure is not recommended.
Dammit, I didn't ask for an opinion...    just tell me whether or not we can    get enough thrust with only a partial    field established...
Affirmative.
All right.  Initiate transit mode,    three-axis stabilization.  Engage    thrusters.
Warning.  Field integrity declining.     Instability at twenty-one percent.
(on the move, to
Warning - Subspace field collapse in
Does anyone here know if the inertial    dampers can feed the deflectors?
A good time to find out.
Computer, transfer energy from the    inertial dampers to reinforce the    subspace field...
Procedure is not recommended.
Dammit... transfer the energy!
Unable to comply.  Level One safety    protocols have cancelled request.
Cancelled it...
Warning.  Subspace field collapse in    thirty seconds.
(yelling to     supernumeraries)   I'm gonna transfer it manually...       On my mark, redirect the flow to the    deflectors...       Keep the power balanced...
Field collapse in fifteen seconds...
Now!
Field energy now within flight    tolerances.
Computer... you and I have to have a    little talk...
The Cardassian warship is in visual    range...
On screen...
They're going right to it...
They've got to listen to reason,    haven't they?  When we warn them    what could happen if they go in    there...
Doctor, most people in my experience    wouldn't know reason if it walked up    and shook their hand.  You can count    Gul Dukat among them.
This is the Federation ship Yangtzee    Kiang... Major Kira Nerys in    command...
Yes, Major...
Gul Dukat, we know you're headed for    the wormhole...
Wormhole?  Which wormhole is that?
I strongly suggest you do not proceed.     We encountered a hostile lifeform    inside...
Perhaps they would be less hostile    to Cardassians than to humans...
Dukat, you know I won't lie to you...    and I know you probably won't listen    to me... but these people are trying    to save you from a lot of trouble.

Really... I suppose you'd also tell    me these are not the lifeforms that    sent the orbs...  or that your    Commander Sisko is not negotiating    for their technology...       Thank you for your concern.  But I    think we'll see for ourselves.
So much for reason...
Jennifer.
Yes, that was her name.
She is part of your existence.
She is part of my past.  She's no    longer alive.
But she is part of your existence.
Yes, she was a most important part    of my existence.  But I lost her    some time ago.
"Lost" - what is this?
In a linear existence, we can't go    back to the past to get something we    left behind... so it's lost...
(come on, you've got     to be kidding)   It is inconceivable that any species    could exist in such a manner... you    are deceiving us...
No, this is the truth...
This day... this park... it was    almost... fifteen years ago.  Far in    the past.  It was a very important    day to me... a day that shaped every    day that followed.
Listen to it...
To what?
The sound of children playing.   What could be more beautiful...
So you like children... ?
That almost sounds like a domestic    inquiry...
I've heard Starfleet officers don't    want families because they complicate    their lives.
Starfleet officers don't often find    mates who want to raise families on    a starship...
That almost sounds like a domestic    inquiry...
(smiles, the question     in his eyes)   I think it was...
Good feelings... happiness...
This is your existence...
Yes.  But... it is difficult to return    here... more difficult than any other    memory...
Why?
Because this was the day... I lost    Jennifer...       ... And I don't want to be here...
Then why do you exist here?
I... I don't understand...
You exist here.
What's wrong... what's happening?
We should be reaching the wormhole    coordinates in two minutes...
Slowing to one-third im-...
Are you sure it collapsed... it could    have withdrawn deeper into subspace...
We haven't found any indication of    that, but we're still checking.
Should I turn this thing around and    go back?
What's your position?
I'll be at your coordinates in less    than three hours...
Maintain your course.  We'll    rendezvous here... by then our scans    should be complete...
Aye, sir.       By the way... we've been getting    queries from the Cardassians since    their ship disappeared from the sensor    field...
I'm sure you have.
They'll see Gul Dukat in about sixty    or seventy years if he starts back    right away.
Talk to me.  Are you still there?
More of your kind.
Another ship... in the wormhole?
"Wormhole" - what is this?
It is how we describe the kind of    passage that brought me here...
It is terminated.
Terminated...
Our existence is disrupted whenever    one of you enters the passage...
Your linear nature is inherently    destructive.
You have no regard for the    consequences of your acts.
That's not true.  We're aware that    every choice we make has a    consequence...
But you claim you do not know what    it will be...
We don't...
Then how can you take responsibility    for your actions...
scene: 227  EXT. FISHING POND - DAY - JAKE ALIEN

quote: We use past experience to help guide    us.

quote: For Jennifer and me, all the    experiences in our lives prepared us    for the day we met on the beach...    helped us recognize that we had a    future together.  When we married,    we accepted all the consequences of    that act, whatever they might be...    including the consequence of you.

quote: "Baseball" - what is this?
scene: 230  REVERSE ANGLE - EXT. BASEBALL FIELD - DAY

quote: I was afraid you'd ask that...
scene: 230  REVERSE ANGLE - EXT. BASEBALL FIELD - DAY

quote: I throw the ball to you... and this    other player stands between us with    a bat, a stick... and he... he tries    to hit the ball in between these two    white lines...
scene: 230  REVERSE ANGLE - EXT. BASEBALL FIELD - DAY

quote: The rules aren't important...  what's    important is -- it's linear.     Every time you throw this ball a    hundred different things can happen    in the game... he might swing and    miss, he might hit it...  the point    is you never know...  you try to    anticipate, set a strategy for all    the possibilities as best you can...    but in the end it all comes down to    throwing one pitch after another...    and seeing what happens.  With each    new consequence, the game begins to    take shape...
scene: 230  REVERSE ANGLE - EXT. BASEBALL FIELD - DAY

quote: And you have no idea what that shape    is until it is completed...
scene: 230  REVERSE ANGLE - EXT. BASEBALL FIELD - DAY

quote: That's right.  In fact, the game    wouldn't be worth playing if we knew    what was going to happen.
scene: 230  REVERSE ANGLE - EXT. BASEBALL FIELD - DAY

quote: You value your ignorance of what is    to come?
scene: 230  REVERSE ANGLE - EXT. BASEBALL FIELD - DAY

quote: (acknowledges, driving     home his point)   That may be the most important thing    to understand about humans.   It is the unknown that defines    our existence.  We are constantly    searching... not just for answers    to our questions... but for new    questions.  We are explorers...    we explore our lives day by day...   and we explore the galaxy, trying    to expand the boundaries of our    knowledge.  And that is why I'm    here.  Not to conquer you either    with weapons or with ideas.  But    to co-exist and learn.
scene: 230  REVERSE ANGLE - EXT. BASEBALL FIELD - DAY

quote: If all you say is true... why do you    exist here?
Mister O'Brien, can you establish a    high energy Thoron field before they    get into sensor range... I don't    want them to be able to scan our    defense systems...
Aye, sir...
They're hailing us.
On screen.
This is First Officer Kira Nerys.
May I speak with the Starfleet    Commander?
He's not available.
I'm not used to talking to Bajoran    Majors.
I'm all you've got.
I am Gul Jasad of the Cardassian    Guard, Seventh Order.  Where is our    warship?
With any luck, they're in the Gamma    Quadrant.  On the other side of the    wormhole.
What wormhole?  Our sensors show no    indication of a wormhole in this    sector.
That's because it just collapsed.
We believe it was artificially    created.  That may be why our sensors    never picked up any of the usual    quantum fluctuation patterns...
You expect me to believe that someone    created a wormhole...   And now conveniently disassembled it?
They're flooding subspace with anti-   lepton interference... it'll cut off    our communications with Starfleet...
... They're powering up their forward    phasers...

Open the channel.

Gul Jasad, I assure you...

I'll need at least a day to make the    necessary preparations...
You have an hour.
I can transfer all available power    to establish partial shields around    critical areas... but if they hit    the docking ring we'll sustain heavy    damage...
Constable... if you would coordinate    moving all personnel to safer    locations...
What was the last reported position    of the Enterprise?
At least twenty hours away...
We've got to hold out till they get    here...

Look for solutions from within,    Commander...

She's gone... there's nothing we can    do...
Warning.  Damage to warp core.   Containment failure in two    minutes...
You go ahead, Lieutenant.  Take the    boy.
The termination of their linear   existence.
Now, sir...
Dammit... we can't leave her here...
I don't know if you can understand.     I see her like this every time I    close my eyes... in the darkness in    the blink of an eye, she's there...    like this...
None of your past experiences helped    prepare you for this consequence...
And I've never figured out how to    live without her.
So you choose to exist here.
It is not linear.
No.  It's not... linear.
Their lead ship is hailing us...
Are you ready, Mister O'Brien... ?
Yessir... when they penetrate our    Thoron field, it should raise a few    eyebrows over there...
All right, then, let's give them our    answer.  Fire six photon torpedoes    across Jasad's bow...
We only have six photons, Major...
We're not going to win this battle    with torpedoes, Chief.
Aye, sir...
An urgent hail from Jasad.
I guess we got his attention.
On screen.
This is your answer... ?
You don't think Starfleet took command    of this space station without the    ability to defend it, do you?
Defend it?  Your space station could    not defend itself against one    Cardassian warship...

You're probably right, Jasad. And if    you were dealing with a Starfleet    officer, they'd probably admit we    have a hopeless cause here... but    I'm just a Bajoran who's been fighting    a hopeless cause against Cardassians    all her life... So if you want a    war, I'll give you one.
Major, remind me never to get into a    game of Roladan Wild Draw with you...
They were using a Thoron field to    block our sensors but we were able    to penetrate it...

When did they receive these armaments?     How did they install them without    our knowledge?
Somehow they've created a massive    illusion of duranium shadows...
But if it is not an illusion...
It is!
Why risk a confrontation?  The Fourth    Order can be here in a day...
And so can Starfleet.

Yes...
Too soon for a victory celebration,    Doctor... Mister O'Brien... ?

Battle stations.

Do it...
Damage report...
Direct hit... level fourteen...     empty storage bays... no casualties...

Controls are locked...
Odo to Ops...
Go ahead.

I'm on my way...

I suspect the sight of their warship    being towed back by a Starfleet    runabout took the heart out of their    fight...

Captain, regarding our conversation    about someone to replace me...

I would prefer you ignore it, sir.

(wanting to share at     least this much)   It was... quite a journey.

So, where can someone practice with    his phaser around here... ?
New rules... ?
You're can't cheat every customer    who walks through your door anymore,    Quark... you're a community leader    now...

If you don't take that hand off my    hip, you'll never be able to raise    another glass with it.
I love a woman in uniform...
